Name: Valid Word Abbreviation
Notes: need two indexes: one to check word and the other for the abbreviation; need also isdigit/isalpha function or ascii char number

Name: First Unique Character in a String
Notes: use .count() function to solve it but also can use ditionaries for saving counts and then return the only unique char

Name: Intersection of Two Arrays
Notes: use a dictionary to save first array then make intersection with the second one (can use set data structure)

Name: Reverse Vowels of a String
Notes: need two indexes: one to start at the array's beginning and one at the end; when idxs are aligned with two vowels you can swap them

Name: Number of Segments in a String
Notes: check spaces in the array: for each word increment an index; if you find a space continue the loop

Name: Find the Difference
Notes: use dictionary to count the strings and return the elem with value 1

Name: Longest Palindrome
Notes: use dictionary to count the number of chars and return the even of all counted number (plus one if we have an odd counted char)

Name: Ransom Note
Notes: use two dictionaries to count the occurrencies of the two char strings and then compare them to find the differencies

Name: Roman to Integer
Notes: use dictionary to map roman numbers to int numbers; need to check if the next number of the string is greater or not

Name: Add Strings
Notes: use two dictionaries to map string numbers to int numbers and viceversa

Name: Valid Parentheses
Notes: use an array that mimics the stack; save in the stack the open brackets and delete them when you find that the opposite is on the top of the stack

Name: Binary Watch
Notes: generate all the times and convert them to two bin number (one for the hour and one for the min); the ones in the bin number are the led you must turn on

Name: Power of Four
Notes: convert to binary and see that a power of four has always one 1 in the leftist digit; the others digits are even 0 (00; 0000; 000000)

Name: Two Sum
Notes: use a dictionary to save the pair (number; index); use a variable called x for saving the difference between target and nums[i] and search x in the dict!

Name: Sum of Two Integers
Notes: need to use XOR to make sum and AND shifted to the left by 1 to take the carry; repeat until carry is 0; for python only you need to use mask to ensure you have only 32bit

Name: Nth digit
Notes: calculate how many digits the number has; calculate what the number is; find out which digit in the number is we wanted
